title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg watches her notorious bouts onstage
text:
Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg (Stephan Savoia/AP) July 19 at 10:07 PM If anyone had needed emergency legal advice during a performance of the Supreme Court-themed opera “Scalia/Ginsburg” in Castleton, Va., they would have been in luck. A cry of “Is there a lawyer in the house?” would have been greeted with a slew of raised hands.
Among those attending performances of the show, which spanned two weekends and closed Sunday, was a who’s who of Washington’s legal-world elite: Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg herself, Solicitor General Donald B. Verrilli Jr. , D.C. Circuit Judge David Tatel , lawyer-turned-congressman Robert Hurt (R-Va.), SCOTUS frequent-flier and Jenner & Block partner Paul Smith , and noted NPR legal-affairs correspondent Nina Totenberg were all spotted taking in the musical tale of the two justices’ unlikely friendship.
One noted jurist who was absenst? Justice Antonin Scalia was in Rome during the opera’s run, Ginsburg told our colleague Geoff Edgers.
